anbn.description:
Suppose we have $G = (\{S\}, \{a,b\}, S, P)$ with production rule:
$S \rightarrow aSb\ |\ ab$
anbn.question: What would the language $L(G)$ for this grammar be?

anbnreg.description:
Suppose we have $G = (\{S\}, \{a,b\}, S, P)$ with production rule:
$S \rightarrow aSb\ |\ ab$
anbnreg.question: Is the language $L(G)$ regular?

grammartype.description:
Suppose we have $G = (\{S\}, \{a,b\}, S, P)$ with production rule:
$S \rightarrow aSb\ |\ ab$
grammartype.question: What is the type of the grammar?

derivation.description:
Suppose we have $G = (\{S\}, \{a,b\}, S, P)$ with production rule:
$S \rightarrow aSb\ |\ ab$

Here is a derivation for $aaabbb$:
$S \Rightarrow aSb \Rightarrow aaSbb \Rightarrow aaabbb$
derivation.question: What do we mean by the derivation of string $aaabbb$?
derivation.answer: Begin with the start variable of the grammar and do replacements until we reach the string $aaabbb$.
choices: Begin with the start variable of the grammar and do replacements until we reach the string $aaabbb$.

sentential.description:
Suppose we have $G = (\{S\}, \{a,b\}, S, P)$ with production rule:
$S \rightarrow aSb\ |\ ab$

Here is a derivation for $aaabbb$:
$S \Rightarrow aSb \Rightarrow aaSbb \Rightarrow aaabbb$

Every step in the derivation process yields what is called a Sentential form.
sentential.question: Based on the derivation of the sting $aaabbb$, select all sentential forms.

q9.description:
Suppose $G = (\{S\}, \{a,b\}, S, P)$
$S \rightarrow aSa\ |\ bSb\ |\ a\ |\ b\ |\ \lambda$
$\Sigma = \{a,b\}$
q9.question: What is the langauge $L(G)$ for this grammar?

q10.description:
Suppose $G = (\{S\}, \{a,b\}, S, P)$
$S \rightarrow aSa\ |\ bSb\ |\ a\ |\ b\ |\ \lambda$
$\Sigma = \{a,b\}$
q10.question: Is this a regular language?
q10.answer: No, we proved that using Pumping Lemma
choices: No, we proved that using Pumping Lemma

$\Sigma = \{a,b\}$
q12.question: Is the string $ababa$ in $L(G)$?

q13.question: Let us derive the sting $ababa$. Which production should we use first?

$S \rightarrow aSa\ |\ bSb\ |\ a\ |\ b\ |\ \lambda$
$\Sigma = \{a,b\}$
q14.question: Substituting $S$ with $aSa$ will give which sentential form?

q15.description:
Suppose $G = (\{S\}, \{a,b\}, S, P)$
$S \rightarrow aSa\ |\ bSb\ |\ a\ |\ b\ |\ \lambda$
$\Sigma = \{a,b\}$
q15.question: Currently we have $S\Rightarrow aSa$. What is the next production rule we will use to derive the string $ababa$?

q16.description:

$S \rightarrow aSa\ |\ bSb\ |\ a\ |\ b\ |\ \lambda$
$\Sigma = \{a,b\}$
q16.question: Currently we have $S\Rightarrow aSa \Rightarrow $. Select the new sentential form that we will get after substituting $S$ with $bSb$

q17.description:

$S \rightarrow aSa\ |\ bSb\ |\ a\ |\ b\ |\ \lambda$
$\Sigma = \{a,b\}$
q17.question: Currently we have $S\Rightarrow aSa \Rightarrow abSba$. What is the next production rule we will use to derive the string $ababa$?

q18.description:
Suppose $G = (\{S\}, \{a,b\}, S, P)$
$S \rightarrow aSa\ |\ bSb\ |\ a\ |\ b\ |\ \lambda$
$\Sigma = \{a,b\}$

Derivation of $ababa$:
$S \Rightarrow aSA \Rightarrow abSba \Rightarrow ababa$
$\Sigma = \{a,b\}$
q18.question: Currently we have $S\Rightarrow aSa \Rightarrow abSba \Rightarrow$. Select the new sentential form that we will get after substituting $S$ with $b$

q20.description:
Consider the grammar $G$ =($\{S,A,B\}$,$\{a,b,c\}$,S,P)
$S\rightarrow AcB$
$A\rightarrow aAa$ | $\lambda$
$B\rightarrow Bbb$ | $\lambda$
q20.question: What is the type for this grammar?
q20.answer: Context-Free Grammar even if it is a Regular Language
choices: Regular Grammar because it is a Regular Language
Context-Free Grammar even if it is a Regular Language

q23.question: Let us derive $aacbb$. What variable do we start with?

q24.question: What will be the sentential form after we substitute $S$?

q25.question: Since we have a sentential form with multiple variables, which variable should be replaced?
q25.answer: We will need some order to be able to write an algorithm to perform replacements.
choices: We will need some order to be able to write an algorithm to perform replacements.
correctFeedback: We have two variables to choose from, so two possible orders to perform replacements.

q27.description:
$G$ =($\{S,A,B\}$,$\{a,b,c\}$,S,P)
$S\rightarrow AcB$
$A\rightarrow aAa$ | $\lambda$
$B\rightarrow Bbb$ | $\lambda$
$\textbf {Definition}$: Leftmost derivation: in each step of a derivation, replace the leftmost variable.
q27.question: Currently, we have $S \Rightarrow AcB$. Following the Leftmost derivation order, which variable should be replaced?
q27.answer: A as it is the leftmost variable
choices: A as it is the leftmost variable
B as it is the rightmost variable
